pr_title: fix: prevent crash entering rendering settings with no renderers

timeline.bodyText: make  transformation "null -> emptyList" in org/terasology/engine/module/rendering/RenderingModuleRegistry.java:121 instead checking on null.
timeline.author: DarkWeird

replies.bodyText:
Odd. The only reason I was getting null-warnings on that site was because this method is explicitly annotated as @Nullable

  
    
      Terasology/engine/src/main/java/org/terasology/engine/module/rendering/RenderingModuleRegistry.java
    
    
        Lines 75 to 76
      in
      73b04de
    
    
    
    

        
          
           @Nullable 
        

        
          
           public List<ModuleRendering> getOrderedRenderingModules() { 
        
    
  


but I don't think it is? that field has a default value, is only set in one other place that looks like it's non-nullable, and is private so I don't think anything else can null it.
replies.author: keturn

replies.bodyText:
I think so too.
I not noticed annotation :3
replies.author: DarkWeird

replies.bodyText: why would you ever return null if you could return an empty list? o.O
replies.author: skaldarnar

timeline.bodyText:
updateRenderingModuleOrder returns orderdRenderingModules
Use it directly
timeline.author: DarkWeird

timeline.message: fix: prevent crash entering rendering settings with no renderers
fix: this method is not nullable
refactor: make use of return value
refactor: make use of return value

timeline.author: skaldarnar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -73,7 +72,6 @@ public ModuleRendering getModuleRenderingByModuleId(Name renderingModuleId) {
      * For use everywhere to get last ordered list of {@link ModuleRendering} instances.
      * @return list of {@link ModuleRendering} instances
      */
-    @Nullable
